text: the Samsung Galaxy s7 has much better
hardware than the iphone but I'm still
not going to make the switch here's what
one of the things i am not a fan of in
the galaxy s7 is the general ecosystem
with every s7 you get you will probably
get bloatware bloatware is basically
pre-installed apps that serve little to
no function they also double up on each
other for example there be two different
messaging apps two different email apps
so here's what I mean about the
bloatware the default messaging app is
verizon's now I don't know anyone who's
been like wow I need this phone from
verizon because of the messaging app why
don't you just use Samsung's as a
default which is okay but it also has a
folder of Google Apps so you have three
different groups of apps and let me just
show you here to here are the verizon
apps completely useless and then you get
the Samsung's own apps Samsung milk
music I don't know anyone who goes out
and says wow I need a samsung smart
phone because of Samsung milk for music
I mean here it comes with Amazon Amazon
music amazon kindle amazon fire these
are things i do not want on my phone yet
are there by default whatever it's not
the biggest deal but it's just don't get
that with iPhone along with the
ecosystem there's also the matter of
Android updates for one reason or the
other samsung phones will get the latest
Android updates months after Google
releases them and that's just something
that I'm not you know comfortable with
doing I like to have the latest and
greatest for security reasons whereas on
the iphone i get updates directly from
apple the day is released there's no
problem there basically the main reason
why is why switch to something more
difficult when I have something so easy
to use already in my iPhone
